comment_body:
> LGTM. Can you also please update the Command Line Reference guide as part of this PR? I realized that the guide did not get updated once we changed the command from `show/config container feature autorestart` to `show/config feature autorestart`, and `show/config feature state` were never added. See: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/blob/master/doc/Command-Reference.md#container-auto-restart.
> 
> Thus can you please do the following:
> 
> 1. Rename (and relocate alphabetically) the sections for `show/config container feature autorestart` to `show/config feature autorestart` and update the example output to display the "always_enabled" states
> 2. Add documentation for `show/config container feature state` commands

Thanks @jleveque for pointing this out. I have updated the document accordingly.

@daall Seems some issue with DVS test case for Policer. 
These failure are un-related to this PR.

> @daall Seems some issue with DVS test case for Policer.
> These failure are un-related to this PR.

ack
retest this please
retest this please
LGTM
i am glad to see kvm test prevent regression.
can you list all exit code?

> can you list all exit code?

@lguohan   Sure. We defined them in consutil's lib.py(https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/blob/master/consutil/lib.py)

```
ERR_DISABLE = 1
ERR_CMD = 2
ERR_DEV = 3
ERR_CFG = 4
ERR_BUSY = 5
```

@abdosi, Please take this PR into 201911 - I have verified that the unit tests were passing locally - thanks !
@judyjoseph: FYI, yesterday I added support to Jenkins to properly test sonic-utilities PRs created against the 201911 branch.

> @judyjoseph: FYI, yesterday I added support to Jenkins to properly test sonic-utilities PRs created against the 201911 branch.

Okay thanks Joe, will check the results then !

@jleveque , the unit tests are passing .. it seems to be failing here, 
```
14:54:33  [htmlpublisher] Archiving at BUILD level /data/johnar/workspace/common/sonic-utilities-build-pr@2/sonic-utilities/htmlcov to /var/jenkins_home/jobs/common/jobs/sonic-utilities-build-pr/builds/3129/htmlreports/RCov_20Report

```

Have you seen this error ? Could you check please ....
Retest this please

> Retest this please

thanks @jleveque the tests pass now , @abdosi can you merge in for next build
retest this please
Thank you so much Joe for root causing this and fixing!

You're welcome, @neethajohn! If the tests pass, I think I will update this PR again and change all shebangs in the repo. Not only is the the preferred shebang, if all scripts use it and this issue arises again, we might be able to catch it sooner.
Retest this please

**DO NOT MERGE UNTIL THIS PR IS MERGED:**

https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/5904
retest this please
@GarrickHe , please fix the test failures on sflow
@prsunny - I looked in the details of the 'default' test. I don't see any information on what failed. Can you please tell me what am I suppose to fix? Thank you.

https://sonic-jenkins.westus2.cloudapp.azure.com/job/common/job/sonic-utilities-build-pr/2896/consoleFull

```
10:07:10      def test_show_sflow(self):
10:07:10          runner = CliRunner()
10:07:10          result = runner.invoke(show.cli.commands["sflow"], [], obj=Db())
10:07:10          print(result.exit_code, result.output)
10:07:10  >       assert result.exit_code == 0
10:07:10  E       AssertionError: assert 1 == 0
10:07:10  E        +  where 1 = <Result KeyError('collector_vrf',)>.exit_code
```
retest this please
retest this please
retest this please
@abdosi  Is the failure in pytest expected?
@jleveque can you please review this? This PR is to avoid the pytest failures seen in sonic-utilities submodule update.

@judyjoseph Should we remove the internal sessions from `show` commands too? I feel it as an implementation details.
If we need to investigate bgp issues with the local sessions in the future , we could use `vtysh`

> @judyjoseph Should we remove the internal sessions from `show` commands too? I feel it as an implementation details.
> If we need to investigate bgp issues with the local sessions in the future , we could use `vtysh`

Yes Pavel, we don't display the internal bgp sessions by default, I have added the o/p of "show ip bgp summary" in the PR description. It will be shown only if user gives the option "-d all" explicitly as the command below. 
"show ip bgp summary -d all"
@pavel-shirshov @arlakshm, please take a look. I wanted to update the unit tests as well..

@judyjoseph  - is this one still needed to be cherry-picked to 201911?

@arlakshm  - please review/approve? Thanks.
@rlhui already in 201911 via direct pr for 201911
retest this please

check the error. 

11:15:50  output = "/usr/bin/env: 'python2': No such file or directory\n"

are you hardcoding python2 in the test?
retest default
retest this please
@lguohan it was a code review comment to change the shebang line to python2.
@jleveque can you please review and approve this?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2293967/98283906-3366fa00-1f55-11eb-8cdc-1f51d4c51711.png)

please increase the coverage to 95%.

> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2293967/98283906-3366fa00-1f55-11eb-8cdc-1f51d4c51711.png)
> 
> please increase the coverage to 95%.

Yes I will be adding more testcases to improve the coverage. But most likely on another separate PR.

> In your CLI output I didn't find a case where the next hops are grouped (unless I missed). For e.g., how would the output for the following route look like.
> 
> ```
> admin@str2-nswitch-acs-4:~$ vtysh -n 1 -c "show ip route 10.0.0.46"
> Routing entry for 10.0.0.46/31
>   Known via "bgp", distance 200, metric 0, best
>   Last update 3d00h06m ago
>   * 10.1.0.4, via PortChannel4003
>   * 10.1.0.6, via PortChannel4004
> 
> admin@str2-nswitch-acs-4:~$ vtysh -n 0 -c "show ip route 10.0.0.46"
> Routing entry for 10.0.0.46/31
>   Known via "bgp", distance 200, metric 0, best
>   Last update 02:11:06 ago
>   * 10.1.0.0, via PortChannel4001
>   * 10.1.0.2, via PortChannel4002
> 
> Can you add an example for the following output:
> 
> admin@str2-nswitch-acs-4:~$ show ip route 10.0.0.46
> ```

The sample you asked actually gets filtered out completely as their nexthops are all back-end interface (LAG) so just based on these two it will not show any output when it is merged.  I understood what you are looking for and I will provide a sample that shows this merged output.
retest default please
retest this please
@gechiang looks like import failures in the test. Can you take a look.

Very interesting... The import bgp_common was fine previously and nothing changed in this from my last commit so not sure why it is failing...  bgpcommon.py is a new file that I am adding as part of this PR so perhaps it is somehow not able to include that in the test build?  It builds fine with my private build...

@smaheshm The failure was due to sonic-utilities recently got converted to PYTHON3 and my changes still had some python2 stuffs such as the import that python3 did not like.  It is fixed now and all tests passed.
Thanks!
i think we need to add the doc for this command line change.

@lguohan @jleveque I updated the documents, I found that there are no clear/connect commands documents although we have those commands.
* Add document for show line and move it to console section
* Add document for config console ...
* Add document for connect/clear line
@kktheballer: Please review, and for future contributions, please ensure to use spaces instead of tabs.

@jleveque Thank you so much for looking into the formatting and for making the changes. I will make sure to use spaces and watch out for unecessary whitespaces from now on. 

I believe one of the checks has failed. Let me try and rerun that first.

@jleveque Let me take a look. Oddly, the errors I see after retest look different from the errors I saw in the original errors of this #1211 PR. 

(In the original PR everything was passing.. Looking into)
retest this please
the unit tests failed. likely due to the refactoring.

> the unit tests failed. likely due to the refactoring.

That's my assumption, also. @kktheballer: Can you please review my changes, and check if I over- or under-indented a section?

@jleveque Thanks for the indentation fix commit. Yes, it appeared that the issue was with the indentation level at which the table  was finally displaying values.

Will keep in mind about the formatting for next time.

This pull request **introduces 1 alert** when merging 3cfef9595ec0ce8bdbfbc01340f7a2da0fd399e5 into 07a4e26bf135e3315a0978e1647a8cfb16fb35e5 - [view on LGTM.com](https://lgtm.com/projects/g/Azure/sonic-utilities/rev/pr-055007d16207943259aa47d57b3f40cade6936af)

**new alerts:**

can you describe the issue? Not sure I understand the issue here.

> can you describe the issue? Not sure I understand the issue here.

Two issues:
1) port speed was not passed to "ns_util()", which was always taking default value "PORT_RATE" for command "portstat".
2) "RX_BPS", "RX_UTIL" calculation was not showing correct values, when traffic is passed at line rate. Functions "ns_brate()" and 
     "ns_util" was using value 1024 instead of 1000 for throughput calculations.
Example, for 1G traffic on port,

util = rate/(port_rate*1024*1024*1024/8.0)*100 --> 93%  (wrong)
util = rate/(port_rate*1000*1000*1000/8.0)*100 --> 100% (correct)

rate = "{:.2f}".format(rate/1024/1024)+' MB' --> 119MB/s (Wrong)
rate = "{:.2f}".format(rate/1000/1000)+' MB' --> 125MB/s (Correct)

Hi, jleveque,

@keboliu, please review this PR, thanks.

you mentioned that a "copper" cable will be judged as invalid port by "platform_sfputil._is_valid_port()", could you elaborate on the invalid cable type here? IMO copper passive cable is valid as AOC cable and can be handled by sfp utilities w/o any error?

> you mentioned that a "copper" cable will be judged as invalid port by "platform_sfputil._is_valid_port()", could you elaborate on the invalid cable type here? IMO copper passive cable is valid as AOC cable and can be handled by sfp utilities w/o any error?

Actually, this is not related to the cable line, but related to the cage on the switch. 
Valid: One of SFP/SFP+/SFP28/QSFP/QSFP-DD can be inserted in the cage of a port.
Invalid: None of SFP/SFP+/SFP28/QSFP/QSF-DD can be inserted in the cage of a port.

> > Valid: One of SFP/SFP+/SFP28/QSFP/QSFP-DD can be inserted in the cage of a port.
> > Invalid: None of SFP/SFP+/SFP28/QSFP/QSF-DD can be inserted in the cage of a port.
> 
> @PJHsieh: I don't understand this. Can you please elaborate?

![Device_Example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49477291/92668264-ee518d80-f340-11ea-929e-4e9c55f1faac.jpg)

> > > Valid: One of SFP/SFP+/SFP28/QSFP/QSFP-DD can be inserted in the cage of a port.
> > > Invalid: None of SFP/SFP+/SFP28/QSFP/QSF-DD can be inserted in the cage of a port.
> > 
> > 
> > @PJHsieh: I don't understand this. Can you please elaborate?
> 
> ![Device_Example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49477291/92668264-ee518d80-f340-11ea-929e-4e9c55f1faac.jpg)

@jleveque @keboliu , Please refer to the above figure.
Only RJ-45 cable can be inserted in  Port 1...Port 48, therefore, invalid for sfputil --- sfputil show presence only output N/A
SFP/SFP+/SFP28 can be inserted in Port 49...Port 52, therefore, valid for sfputil --- sfputil show presence output "Not Present" or "Present"
QSFP can be inserted in Port 53~Port54, therefore, valid for sfputil --- sfputil show presence output "Not Present" or "Present".
@jleveque @keboliu , do you still have any concern ?

> @jleveque @keboliu , do you still have any concern ?

this is a very rare case, I mean haven't seen any platform supporting RJ45 ports in the SONiC community before, but yes I think this issue is valid.  But I think you also need to override _is_valid_port() somewhere?

> > @jleveque @keboliu , do you still have any concern ?
> 
> this is a very rare case, I mean haven't seen any platform supporting RJ45 ports in the SONiC community before, but yes I think this issue is valid. But I think you also need to override _is_valid_port() somewhere?

The "_is_valid_port" is defined in class class SfpUtilBase in sonic_platform_base/sonic_sfp/sfputilbase.py, and can be override by the derived class. The device vendors take the responsibility for implementing  their own _is_valid_port().

The main point for this PR is:
If this port is not valid for sfp, the 'N/A' is suggest to be shown.
If this port is valid for sfp, "Not Present" or "Present" shall be shown.
